result.execSummary:
The defendant Leah Hayat Jicha was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. sentence credit of 222 days were granted if imposed.
Consecutive to: Cases 22cf495 and 22CF634

miscConds.notes: Standard Court costs and DNA surcharge were waived by the court.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent. Comply with any Mental Health/Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate. No Dangerous Weapons (e.g. Knives, Firearms, etc).
No association with any known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 1:35 p.m.
Attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon in court for Leah Hayat Jicha. 
Defendant Leah Hayat Jicha in court, in custody.  
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  2 YEARS
Initial Confinement:  1 YEAR
Extended Supervision: 1 YEAR
222-Days Credit, if Revoked
Sentence is to run Consecutive to 22CF495 and 22CF634.

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.  
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  3 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
Mental Health/Psychological Evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate
No Dangerous Weapons (e.g. Knives, firearms, etc.)

COSTS:  $268.00 (WAIVED BY THE COURT)
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (WAIVED BY THE COURT)
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
*Cash bail posted on this case in the amount of $1,250.00 - $1,000.00 is to be applied to Restitution on case 22CF495 and $250.00 is to be applied to 22TR191.*

CONDITION TIME: 90-DAYS JAIL commencing forthwith.

09:31 AM Defendant Leah Hayat Jicha in court, in custody, with attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case called for review hearing in 22CF108 and 22CF308.
Atty Mcmahon was only recently appointed. 
Report found Defendant to be competent.
State is in agreement with the findings.
Attorney Mcmahon is not challenging the doctors report.  Defendant does not wish to challenge the report.
Court finds the Defendant to be competent and cases may proceed.
State has complied with victim's rights.
Defense has filed a motion to modify bail in 22CF545.
Defense makes argument for reducing bail on the record.
State objects to any modification of bail for reasons as stated on the record.
Defense requests that all cases be placed on the calendar for preliminary hearing as soon as possible. 
Defendant's father makes statement to the court.
The Court will not take any action on bail at this time.
Court will set a bail/bond hearing in front of Judge Melvin to allow defense to secure a place for the Defendant to stay for treatment and potentially someone who could co-sign a signature bond.
All cases to be set for Preliminary Hearing.
Defense tolls time limits for preliminary hearing.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 08:15 am.  Hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.
